title: Rate of methyl iodide and hydroxide

content.question:
<math alttext="C H 3 I plus N a O H produces C H 3 O H plus N a I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>I</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>â†’</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>NaI</mtext></mrow></math>
The rate of the reaction represented by the chemical equation shown above is expressed as <math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of C H 3 I, times the molar concentration of N a O H " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msub><mrow><mtext>[CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>3</mtext></mrow></msub><mtext>I][NaOH]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on this information, which of the following claims is correct?

choices.label: The reaction will proceed at a slower rate with increasing temperature.

The rate of the reaction will double when the concentrations of both <math alttext="C H 3 I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N a O H " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are doubled.

The rate of the reaction will double if the concentration of <math alttext="C H 3 I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is doubled while keeping the concentration of <math alttext="N a O H " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> constant.

A larger amount of <math alttext="C H 3 O H " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be produced if the concentrations of <math alttext="C H 3 I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N a O H " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are halved.

content.answer: The rate of the reaction will double if the concentration of <math alttext="C H 3 I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is doubled while keeping the concentration of <math alttext="N a O H " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> constant.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
